page.title: 10A Burscough Teenage Saturday
page.content: By Paula .......................... It was July 14th, 1985 and today I was going to Chorley with the rest of Rufford Morris Dancers for a large competition.The bus was meant to pick us up at 10.55 but, as usual,it was thirty minutes late .After the bus had picked up me and all the other girls,we set off for Chorley.We got changed on the bus into our parade costumes and then we were dropped off at the start of the parade .We then had our dinner before we went to the arena.We danced at 4.25. We danced for fifteen minutes while being judged.Then after all the other troops had danced we lined up to see if we had been placed.We came first.We got home at 8.55.I watched a bit of "Live Aid",but I was to tired to watch it all and fell asleep.
